intro.headline: Leeds Fashion Futures
intro.description:
We’ve launched Leeds Fashion Futures to see how as a city we can reduce the environmental impact of our clothing choices. 

In partnership with the RSA, we’ve been exploring this city's unique relationship with clothing and textiles, its rich heritage, and the talent, creativity and knowledge that exists now.  We've discovered a hotbed of activity, from the grassroots groups gathering in communities to share skills, to the mills where world-leading luxury fabrics are created to the young designers committed to working sustainably.  

Could Leeds lead the way in sustainable fashion? We think so.  We're sharing the many ways to recycle, reuse, exchange and repair clothing & textiles, along with top tips and ideas from the many people we're working with on this project.

Need help? 
 Hire us!
hire.description:
Our expertise lies in developing behaviour change campaigns that help people and organisations to waste less.

Are you interested in us working with you? 

We have a strong track record for developing engaging, impactful campaigns that create change.  Our 10 week #stayathome waste reduction campaign - developed at the start of lockdown in March and delivered for Leeds City Council - is the latest example of this.  You can read our impact report [here](https://drive.google.com/file/d/19LPgf0gzOOzYTYmitXUZje8d2BwdeAXG/view).

projects.title: School uniform re-use
projects.description: We want to make second-hand school uniform first choice in Leeds.  Our Leeds School Uniform Exchange project is supporting people across the city to swap uniform at their school or in their local community.

projects.title: #LeedsbyExample
projects.description: \#LeedsbyExample is an award winning campaign that we're extremely proud to be part of.  In it's first year, recycling rates in our city centre tripled from 17% to 49% which led to it being rolled out to other cities in the UK. Leeds truly leading the way.  We're now leading on the next phase.
